00006 /*
00007    The intent of this file is to create a set of functions providing the kernel with easy manipulation of the virtual file system.
00008    the file also contains a pointer to the root node of root_fs for easy access
00009 
00010    STATUS: Working, no immediate revision needed
00011 */

00013 fs_node_t* root_fs = 0;
00014 
00015 void init_root_fs() 
00016 {
00017         root_fs = create_rfs_directory("root", 0);
00018 }
00019 
00020 fs_node_t* init_vfs() 
00021 {
00022         if (root_fs != 0) return root_fs;
00023 
00024         init_root_fs();
00025 
00026         return root_fs;
00027 }

00029 int is_directory(fs_node_t* node) 
00030 {
00031 
00032         if ((node->flags & FS_DIR) == FS_DIR) 
00033         {
00034                 return 1;       
00035         }
00036 
00037         return 0;
00038 }

00040 uint32 read_fs(fs_node_t* node, uint32 offset, uint32 size, uint8* buffer)
00041 {
00042 
00043   // Has the node got a read callback?
00044   if (node->read != 0)
00045   {
00046     return node->read(node, offset, size, buffer);
00047   }
00048   else 
00049   {
00050     return 0;
00051   }
00052 
00053 }

00066     return 0;

00091 struct dirent* readdir_fs (fs_node_t* node, uint32 idx) {
00092 
00093         if (node->parent == 0)
00094         {
00095                 if (idx == 0)
00096                 {
00097                         struct dirent* ret = (struct dirent*) malloc(sizeof(struct dirent));
00098                         memset(ret, 0, sizeof(struct dirent));
00099                         strcpy(ret->name, ".");
00100                         return ret;
00101                 }
00102                 else
00103                 {
00104                         idx = idx - 1;
00105                 }
00106         }
00107         else
00108         {
00109                 if (idx == 0)
00110                 {
00111                         struct dirent* ret = (struct dirent*) malloc(sizeof(struct dirent));
00112                         memset(ret, 0, sizeof(struct dirent));
00113                         strcpy(ret->name, ".");
00114                         return ret;
00115                 }
00116                 else if (idx == 1)
00117                 {
00118                         struct dirent* ret = (struct dirent*) malloc(sizeof(struct dirent));
00119                         memset(ret, 0, sizeof(struct dirent));
00120                         strcpy(ret->name, "..");
00121                         return ret;
00122                 }
00123                 else
00124                 {
00125                         idx = idx - 2;
00126                 }
00127         }
00128 
00129         if (node->readdir != 0)
00130         {
00131                 return node->readdir(node, idx);
00132         }
00133 
00134         return 0;
00135 }

00137 fs_node_t* finddir_fs (fs_node_t* node, char* name) {
00138 
00139         if (strcmp(name, "..") == 0)
00140         {
00141                 return node->parent;
00142         } else if (strcmp(name, ".") == 0)
00143         {
00144                 return node;
00145         }
00146 
00147         if (node->finddir != 0) 
00148         {
00149                 return node->finddir(node, name);
00150         }
00151 
00152         return 0;
00153 }

00185 fs_node_t* evaluate_path(const char* path, fs_node_t* start_directory)
00186 {
00187         if (!path) return 0;
00188         if (!start_directory) return 0;
00189 
00190         unsigned int path_length = strlen(path);
